item.title: D&BA: T-Phonic
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Straight out the lab and into the studio Viper recordings new boy 'T-Phonic' showcases his skills for this exclusive podcast for DnB arena. Hosted by Kool fm's very own MC Mekar.
This up front mix is carefully crafted showcasing a few of his own dub plates and a few classics thrown in for good measure, this mix is sure to take you on a journey through every spectrum of drum and bass.
Previously under the name 'Kinetics', T was responsible for the massive 'Back to My Other Life remix' which was the signature tune of Bobby Friction and Nihal's prime time BBC Radio 1 show, getting licensed to their "Presents..."LP selling over 200, 000 copies to date.
His first release on Viper 'Keep Moving' & 'Overload' smashed dancefloors world wide with support from the likes of DJ Hype, Matrix, Futurebound, Sigma and J.Majik. His new Viper 12" which features the heavy funked out tracks "You make me feel" and "Spark of a flame" are set to drop in the late autumn of 2008.
Forthcoming releases on Viper V.I.P, Bad Taste, Abstract inc. and Q Recordings. His brand of powerful and eclectic musical drum and bass is seeing him become one of the scenes brightest new talents.
Track listings for dnbarena podcast.
1. TAKE ME AWAY - CHASE & STATUS 2a BACK TO THE JUNGLE - STATE OF MIND 2. FUTUREBOUND vs BROOKES BROS - DAWN TREADER 3. THE DARK INSIDE ME - T-PHONIC 4. PASSIVE AGRESSIVE - BREAK 5a THE NINE - BAD COMPANY 5. TIMEWARP - SUB FOCUS 6. JUDGEMENT - CHASE & STATUS 7. COME AROUND - SIGMA 8. KILLAZ - HAZARD 9. MANKIND - DC BREAKS 10. HOVERCRAFT - ZEN 11a FEELINGS - SHY FX 11. CANT STOP IT - T-PHONIC 12. SNAKE CHARMER - SHIMON vs SPARFUNK 13. SAME OLD BLUES - APEX 14. X-RAY - SUB FOCUS 15. MOVING ON - METRIK 16. DICO DODO - LYNX 17. U MAKE ME FEEL ALRIGHT - T-PHONIC

item.title: D&BA: Noah D
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
As his brand new release ìFire Songî b/w ìWater Songî drops for Drum&BassArena Download, Noah D treats us to plenty of dubs and fresh new tracks on Pure Vibez, Intrigue, Function & Sudden Def

item.title: D&BA: Redeyes
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Emerging as a DJ on the French Drum&Bass scene in 1999. Redeyes quickly gained recognition for his eclectic selection & tight mixing. This podcast is 90 minutes showcasing his tastes & talents.
TRACKLIST:
14:47 1 redeyes - clapslap - cia deepkut 02 Random Movement, Mixmaster Doc & Focus - My Sentiments - innerground 03 Lomax - BigFoot 04 Lynx - break the mod - soulr 05 Digital hunters - red glass - innerground 06 Mutt - rumours - horizons 07 redeyes - let it shine - spearhead 08 brookes brothers - tear you down - bbk 09 lenzman - untitled (last day on earth) 10 breakage - come back - bassbin 11 optical - the shining remix - metro 12 LIS - The Phlebass Consideration - play muzik 13 nu:tone - troopers 14 SPY - flash point ok 15 Bill Riley - the chill - full cycle 16 calibre & spacek - shine - signature 17 redeyes & sweed - poetry in motion - spearhead 18 random movement, focus, mixmaster doc & noah d - sacrifice 19 lenzman - mesmerized 20 naibu - opium lady 21 eveson - simply 22 calibre - always lovin you - signature 23 d bridge - mr malcontent - exit 24 seba & krazy - finola - innerground 25 naibu - aki - breakin 26 d bridge - true romance - metalheadz 27 calibre - ringtone - samurai music 28 SPY - new begining 29 fracture & neptune - killerwhat - play musik 30 icicle - spartan - shogun 31 instra:mental - rogue - darkestral 32 Photek - Rings around Saturn

item.title: D&BA: NC-17
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Signing their first two hard hitting tracks to Sinuous Recordings in 2004, thereís now no stopping this Toronto based duo who have lined up releases on DSCI4, MAC II, Circle, Sudden Def and just recently signing a single to Andy C Ram Sister label Frequency.

item.title: D&BA: Profile

item.title: D&BA: JFB
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
JFB Uk DMC Champion 2007 Runs Ground breaking night Battlejam with 2x Uk Beatbox Champion Beardyman. Apart from being a turntabalist playing a various selection, JFB has a Drum&Bass upbringing & has been playing nights like Movement since 2000.This mix consists of 23 rolling tracks with a few exlucives donated from Ed Solo, some beatjuggling at the beggining and a nice amount of scratching mixed on three decks and 2 seratos live in his bedroom studio, is 50mins long.
Tracklist:
1 : Total Science - Listen 2 : A sides - Tear The Roof Off - Twisted Indivividual Rmx 3 : Futurebound & Brookes Brothers -Dawn Treader 4 : Utah Jazz - Riddim Track 5 : Danny Byrd - From Bath With Love Feat. T-Lace 6 : Total Science - Catch Up 7 : Lynx -Distance Zero 8 : Optimist - High Volume 9 : Dj Panik - Dead Or Alive 10: Metrik - Movin On 11: Danny Byrd - Planet Music V.I.P Feat. Mc Foxy & Adrock 12: JFB & Ed Solo - Milkbottle 13: SpectraSoul - Tectonics 14: Utah Jazz - Cloud Nine 15: Ed Solo & JFB - Chains 16: London Elektricity - Attack Ships On Fire 17: Ed Solo - Checkpoint 18: Metrik - Stranger 19: Red Polo - ComeBooty 20: Wax & Cls - Feeling Good 21: Danny Byrd - Supersized 22: Red Polo - BamBam Booty 23: Pendulum - 9000 Miles

item.title: D&BA: Aggers
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
DRUM&BASSARENA resident DJ Aggers delivers a massive mix for this weeks Podcast, with an hour of upfront tracks stretching across all D&B sub genres. Aggers is available for bookings on the DRUM&BASSARENA AGENCY at http://management.breakbeat.co.uk.
1.Collie Budz - Come Around (Sigma Remix) - Dub 2.Break - Lead The Way - Commercial Suicide >>Mistical - Mistical Dub - Soul_r 3.Subterra & Dekko - The End - Frequency Dub 4.Fierce & Optiv - Surface Noise - Quarantine 5.D Bridge & Calibre - Ponderosa - Exit 6.Spectrasoul - The Tube - Shogun Audio 7.Nympho & Proxima - Knock Knock - Frequency 8.Commix - Painted Smile 9.Lomax - Metal Flange - Co-Lab 10.Subterra - Steppaholic - Frequency 11.Will Miles - Private Account - Dub 12.Mixmaster Doc - Drippen Off - Brand:Nu Dub 13.Roni Size & DJ Die - Music Box (Sigma Remix) - Full Cycle Dub 14.DJ Die & Clipz - Black Doves - Full Cycle 15.Tommy Boy - Old Texaco Garage VIP - D Style 16.Break - Destiny Comes Ringing - Commercial Suicide >>Dillinja - Hard Noize - Test 17.Mikal - Distance - Westbay Dub 18.Spectrasoul - Alibi - Critical 19.Loxy & Matt U - Jumanji - Westbay Dub 20.Chase & Status - Judgement (Informer) - Ram >>Ed Rush & Optical - Watermelon - Virus 21.Icicle - Minus - Shogun Audio 22.Instramental - Rogue - Darkestral 23.Subterra & Dekko - Revolution - 31 Records Dub 24.D Bridge - Creatures Of Habit - Exit

item.title: D&BA: Shock One
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Coming from a traditionally trained musical background Shockone bring a unique sound to the drum and bass music scene, discovering the sound through artists like Bad Company, Konflict and Ed Rush & Optical.
It was when ShockOneís tune ëSilverscreení dropped at a pendulum return show that things started to really move. Having torn the roof off it wasnít long before Dj Friction had picked it up for his own imprint Shogun audio, backed up with Dropping science this was a debut release that made the world take notice, gaining support from Friction, Andy C and Hype to name a few. Followed by this release was ëItís Oní which featured the musical side of the Duo utilizing live guitars resulting in an energetic party anthem that proved Shockone were more than reeces and amens
On the DJ front Shockones sets have built a reputation for consistently causing uncontrollable body movement, flailing limbs and general frenzied behaviour among crowds. Having played along side the likes of Andy C, Dj Fresh, Pendulum, Dj Friction to name a few, Shockone has proven to be a force to be reckoned with, not only in the studio, but also on stage, always retaining a strong musical element in sets while still keeping the energy at maximum level.

item.title: D&BA: Young AX
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
This is musical d&b at its finest, but still packing enough punch to rock the dancefloor!" (Kmag #61 on Young Ax Higher Ground album).
"I definitely don't like predictable tracks, based on loops and stuff. I want something to happen during the tune. Itís like a live show where someone is playing a wrong note." (Young AX)

item.description:
Turntablist supreme DJ AMC steps up for his first DRUM&BASSARENA Podcast. This is 3 deck mayhem at its best. Cramming in an unbelievable 44 tracks, this mix is as fast and furious as they come. A regular fixture for D&BTV Live, AMC's energy and passion for the music is guaranteed to give nothing but good vibes.
01. Void Dweller - Break (Metalheadz) 02. Deadline - Drumsound & Simon Bassline Smith Remix (Function) 03. Beast City - Original Sin VIP (Ganja) 04. Robocop - Taxman Remix (Playaz) 05. Gun Fingers - Dirty Harry (Front Line) 06. Bounty Hunter - Dj Pleasure (Music Hurtz) 07. Power of RA - Ebony Dubsters (Ebony) 08. Cheater Cheater - Original Sin (Ganja) 09. The Bells - Dj Motion (Max Ammo) 10. Nosher - Baron Remix (CIA) 11. Flesh Wound - G Dub Remix (Viper) 12. The Beginning - Moving Fusion (Ram) 13. Goblin - Zinc (Bingo) 14. New Generation - Clipz (Full Cycle) 15. Kombat - Crisis Remix (Dub) 16. Dark Solider - Dj Vapour Remix (Dread) 17. Shadow Boxing - Nasty Habits (31 recs) 18. KDC - Harmful (Dub) 19. Night - Digital Sound Boy Remix (Tempa) 20. Bass Drive - Drum & Bass Republic (Dub) 21. The Code - SKC Remix (Renegade) 22. Bacteria - Pendulum Remix (Virus) 23. Altitude - Break Remix (Shogun) 24. Run Off - Break (Quarantine) 25. Silver Steez - Loxy & Gremlinz (Cylon) 26. The Nine - Bad Company (BC recs) 27. Frontline - Zeal & Litta (Dark Asylum Dub) 28. 8 Bit Bitch - Spor Remix (Evol Intent Recs) 29. Ladies Night VIP - Demo & Cease (Human Imprint) 30. Koeko - Thought (Dub) 31. Darkness - Su3ject Remix (Trick Disc Recs) 32. Loader - Chase & Status (BC Recs) 33. Dial Tone - Zeal & Litta (Dark Asylum Dub) 34. The Break - Hade's (36h Chamber) 35. Franky Mountain - Icicle & Nymfo (Ram) 36. Hardware - Operata M (Dub) 37. Late Nights - Icicle (Critical) 38. Lost & Found - Break (Symmetry Recs) 39. Walking On Mars - Drum & Bass Republic (Dub) 40. Disco Dodo - Lynx (Creative) 41. Watermelon - Ed Rush & Optical (Virus) 42. Shrapnel - Billian (Dub) 43. The Pulse - Bad Company (Prototype) 44. The Apprentice - Proktah (Trust In Music)

item.title: D&BA: Xample
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Having grown up in Bristol, Xample has always been surrounded by the sounds of drum n bass. Having attracted the interest of Andy C and the Ram crew, Xample has fast become one of the drum n bass success stories of 2008. With more releases on Ram in the pipeline, Xample lays down this podcast to give us a preview of what to expect from him in the future.
1.Xample - Automatic (Ram) 2.Clipz - Ugly (Audio Zoo) 3.Zen - Jah Colours RMX (Low Down Deep) 4.Xample - Lowdown VIP (Ram) 5.Icicle & Nymfo - Franky Mountain (Ram) 6.Xample & Lomax - Contra (Ram) 7.Nymfo & Proxima - Headless Housefly (Frequency) 8.Phobia & Jubie - Guillotine (Hardware) 9.Xample - Heaven & Hell RMX (Ram) 10.Danny Byrd & Brookes Brothers - Goldrush (Hospital) 11.TC & Subfocus - Borrowed Time VIP (D Style) 12.Subfocus - Timewarp (Ram) 13.Zen - Double Bobblee (Grid) 14.Xample - Breath & Stop (Frequency)

item.title: D&BA: Futurebound
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Co-founder of the mighty Viper label, Futurebound has been as busy as anyone in the studio of late. Here he lays down an hour of mayhem and crams in more tunes than you can shake a fist at.
Tracklist
01. Futurebound & Matrix – Womb – Viper / Metro 02. Futurebound & Matrix – The edge – Viper / Metro 03. Militia – let loose ( T.C Remix) – Shogun Dillinja – Goin In - Test 04. Subfocus – Triple X – Ram 05. Clipz feat Hollie G – Ugly – Audio zoo 06. Brookes Brothers & subfocus – Late Run – Ram 07. Baron – Turn up the sun – BBK 08. Futurebound V’s Brookes Brothers – Dawn treader – BBK Hazard – Selector – Ganja 09. Nu tone – System (Matrix & Futurebound rmx) (Hospital) 10. Brookes Bothers – Crackdown (Viper) 11. Peshay – Don’t think about me (Infrared) 12. T.C & Subfocus – Borrowed time (VIP) (D-Style) 13. Psidream & Pacific – Throwback Ram Trilogy – Titan (Ram) 14. Shimon & Andy-C – Skirmish (Ram) Roni size – Snapshot (Full cycle) 15. Commix – Be true (Metalheadz) Clipz & Die – Good ol days (Full Cycle) 16. Shimon & Sanj – Untitled (Audio Porn) 17. Upbeats V’s White Stripes Dillinja – In the grind (Valve) 18. L-Plus – Middle East Sun (Viper) 19. Die & clipz – Back inside (Clear Skyz) Baron – Red head (Virus) 20. Chase & Status – Judgement (Ram) 21. C4C – Sleeper Cell (C4C) 22. T.C – Driver (D-Style) 23. J-Majik & Wickaman – Fleshwound (G-Dub Remix) (Viper) 24. Shock One – Untitled (Viper) 25. Hive – Neo (2008 remix) (Violence) Icicle & Nympho – Franky mountain (Ram) 26. Die – Dirty Games (G-Dub remix) (Chronic) 27. Subfocus – Timewarp (Ram) 28. DC Breaks – Romper (Viper) 29. Metrik – Zero Gravity (Viper)

item.title: D&BA: DJ Empress
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
DJ Empress has been smashing clubs worldwide for over eleven years. Hailing from New York, Empress has toured all over Europe and Asia, also having played almost every major city in North America. With such a global reputation, this is a podcast not to be missed.
Tracklist
1. Valium Express - Dose, Trei & Menace 2. Compound - Ed Rush & Optical (Virus Recordings) 3. Womb- Matrix & Futurebound (ViperMetro Recordings) 4. Shadowpath- Axiom & Psidream (Shadowlaw Recordings) 5. Zone Defense- Mindmapper (Crunch Recordings) 6. Survival of the Fittest- NC-17 (Mac 2 Records) 7. Derailed - Dose (Redlight Recordings) 8. Phalanx - Axiom 9. Dawn Treader Master - Brookes Brothers vs Futurebound 10. Scream to the Stars - Concord Dawn & Chris Su 11. Dropout - Cause 4 Concern 12. Tin God - The Upbeats (Uprising Recordings) 13. Dual Processed - Teebee & Calyx ft-Verse 14. Mankind - DC Breaks (VIper Recordings) 15. Swamp Thing - Subfocus (Ram Records) 16. Slug Path - NC-17 (DSCi4) 17. Fleshwound RMX- J Majik & Wickaman (G Dub RMX) (Viper Recordings) 18. The Media is a Joke - Gridlok (CIA Recordings) 19. Words of Wisdom - Dose (Revolution Recordings) 20. The Revenge - Loxy & Munk (X-Tinction Agenda) 21. Disco Dodo - Lynx (Creative Source) 22. Connected - Maldini & Empress (dub) 23. Druggy - Subfocus (Ram Records) 24. Camouflage Relick - Bulletproof & The Upbeats (Cyanide Recordings) 25. Romper - DC Breaks (Viper Recordings)

item.title: D&BA: Bungle
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Following in the footsteps of other legendary Brazilian dance acts DJ Patife and DJ Marky, Bungle is on course to have the same impact as his predecessors, if not more, on the global stage.
Taking time out from his hectic production and DJing schedule (including a tour in May that is going to take him to Paris, Cologne, Moscow, Austria, Poland, Estonia and Chelmsford) Bungle drops an exclusive mix for D&BArena featuring that Brazilian touch you've come to expect.
Tracklist:
1. Human Factor - Japanese Delight 2. Random Movement - Thick Liquid 3. Child Support - Green Cross Code (Bungle remix) 4. Q Project - Tears (Marky & Bungle remix) 5. Amaning & Dubwise - Smash VIP 6. Bungle feat. Total Science & Ayah - Snake Eyes (Bungle VIP) 7. High Contrast - Everything is Different (Calibre remix) 8. Bungle - Good Times 9. Commix - Faceless (Marcus Intalex remix) 10. Break - The Drone 11. Bungle - The Need Of Being Alone 12. Break - Vanishing Point 13. Bungle - Be Like This 14. Mistical - Mistical Dub 15. Omni Trio - Renegade Snares (High Contrast remix) 16. Electrosoul System - Purple Sky 17. Marky & Bungle - Let Me Tell Ya 18. Invaderz - 32bit Jungle 19 Noisia & Black Sun Empire - Infusion 20. Klute - Tranceformat 21. Commix - Belleview 22. Mikrob - Never Win

item.title: D&BA: Logan D and Evil B
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Logan D has risen to prominence in the last few years becoming one of the best up and coming DJs in the scene as well as running his successful label, Low Down Deep Recordings and presenting his own bi-weekly Kool FM Show. Catch this awesome podcast as Logan treats us to some highly anticipated Low Down Deep dubplates, with Evil B controlling the mic.
Tracklist
1. Jah Colours - Mutated Forms - ( Zen remix ) Low Down Deep Dub 2. Cheater Cheater - Original Sin - Frontline 3. Rah - Shy FX - Ebony Dub 4. Double Bobble - Zen - Grid 5. Twilight Zone - Sly - Low Down Deep Dub 6. Offline - Clipz- Audio Zoo 7. Don't Trust - Soulpride - Foundation Music Dub 8. U Don't Understand - Heist- ( Taxman remix ) - Colab Recs 9. Hustlerz and Dealerz feat. Dread MC - Jaydan - Smokin Riddems 10. Wishmaster - Pleasure - Low Down Deep Dub 11. You Got The Nerve - Sly - Low Down Deep Dub 12. Slut- Double Zero - Frontline 13. Wizard - Pleasure - 14. Hovercraft - Zen - Grid 15. Crank - Soulpride - Foundation Music 16. Ambush - Heist

item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Coming straight out of San Francisco, newcomers Bachelors of Science have already become a well known name in the global dnb scene with their unique rolling, liquid sound. The duo, originally hailing from the UK and New Zealand, have had strong support from the likes of LTJ Bukem, Brian Gee, Bailey and High Contrast after dropping a a string of strong releases on Horizons Music. With their debut album 'Science Fiction' landing last month to critical acclaim they take time out to put together this excellent mix for Drum & Bass Arena.
Tracklist:
1. Death Cab For Cutie - Brothers On A Hotel Bed (Bachelors Of Science Remix) 2. Mutt and Redeyes - Sugar 3. Bachelors Of Science - Spanish Sun 4. Zyon Base - Ghetto Blues 5. Bachelors Of Science - Strings Track 6. Bachelors Of Science - Strings Track (Apex Remix) 7. Blu Mar Ten Vs Erykah Badu - You Got Me (Remix) 8. Saburuko and Mixmaster Doc - Copperhead 9. Well Being - Smoke Screen 10. Bachelors Of Science - People Together
Enjoying the Drum & Bass Arena Podcast? Reckon you know who we should have next? Having issues downloading or playing them? Anything else Podcast related you want to tell us? Then please email: podcasts@breakbeat.co.uk with your feedback.

item.title: D&BA: Mixmaster Doc
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Mixmaster Doc has burst onto the scene almost overnight, swiftly gaining support from leading figures such as Doc Scott, Fabio, Bailey and Randall. With releases on 31 Records & Diverse Products and forthcoming tracks on Creative Source, Sonorous, Mac II, Brand Nu and Nu Directions the future is bright for the man coming straight out of South Carolina. His D&BA podcast takes you on a journey through deeper, cutting edge sounds from peers such as Spectrasoul, Icicle, Lynx, Nu Tone, Lenzman and the Doc himself. Essential listening.
Tracklist:
1. Peyo ft sks - Without U 2. Spectrasoul - Adoration 3. Nymfo and Proxima - Knock Knock > Total Science - Make Me Feel 4. Lenzman - Caught Up 5. Hobzee and Zyon Base - Sad Song 6. Insight - Never Always 7. Lynx and Aaron Jay - Wait For Me 8. Spectrasoul - Submission 9. Nutone - Troopers 10. Icicle and Nymfo - Green Goblin > Zinc and Eksman - Drive By Car 11. Generic and Perpetuum - Medicina 12. Mixmaster Doc - My Tongue is Poison 13. Hobzee - What Else 14. Peyo - That's What You Do To Me (Random Movement Remix) 15. Random Movement - Psychodelic Drainpipe 16. Mixmaster Doc -Trip 17. Mixmaster Doc and Focus - Strike at the Wind 18. Mixmaster Doc - Macrophage 19. Mixmaster Doc - She Dances 20. Steluce and Addiction - Do What I Miss 21. Icicle - Nowhere 22. Mixmaster Doc - Never Loved You

item.title: D&BA: Randall J-Tek Mix
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
J-Tek is a new project with the aim to bring back the long lost sound of Jungle Techno. The project is a collaboration between Outrage (Backlash, Metalheadz, Basement Records), Digital (Function, Timeless, Metalheadz), Modular (HardLeaders, Flex, Lab Logic), Aperture (Whisper Audio, Metalheadz, Paradox Music), and the original jungle don Randall (Mac II, Metalheadz, Reinforced). As a special introduction Randall drops this label mix featuring brand new tracks alongside vintage Jungle Tekno from the likes of Lennie De Ice...it's time to get to know about the J-Tek sound!
Tracklist:
1. Living In A Basement - Modular - J-Tek Records 2. The Buck Stops Here - Modular - J-Tek Records 3. Jungle Dub - Modular - J-Tek Records 4. Acid Drop - Outrage - J-Tek Records 5. Work the Box - Potential Bad Boy - Limited E Edition 6. Falling Bombs - Modular & Outrage - J-Tek Records 7. Sunday Morning - Allsorts - Outrage & Modular(RMX) - J-Tek Records 8. Cry - Outrage - J-Tek Records 9. We I E - Lennie De-Ice - Reel 2 Reel 10. Made In England - Outrage & Digital - J-Tek Records 11. Scorcher - 4 Hero - Reinforced Records 12. Gladiator - Modular - J-Tek Records 13. Charm - De-Men-Tation- Bassmentation 14. Dark NRG - Modular - J-Tek Records 15. Utopia - Outrage - J-Tek Records 16. 2012 - Modular - J-Tek Records 17. Stop! - Outrage - J-Tek Records 18. Escape - Aperture - J-Tek Records

item.title: D&BA: Nero
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Ahead of the very special World Of Drum & Bass meets Drum & Bass Arena event in Miami in March, Nero set pulses racing in anticipation with a ferocious mix of upfront DnB pressure. The duo, signed to Formation since 2004 and responsible for last year's electro-step anthem 'Energy', are also set to launch their own imprint 'Punchy Recordings' this year. Check out the mix featuring the forthcoming tracks from their new label, 'Solid Air' and 'Choices', as well as recent dance floor anthems from fellow leaders of the new skool Culture Shock, Sub Focus and Brookes Brothers.
Tracklist:
1. NERO - Solid Air - Punchy Recordings 2. Greenlaw - After I'm Gone (NERO Remix) - Formation >>>>Sub Focus - Swamp Thing - RAM 3. Danny Byrd - Shock Out - Hospital 4. Justice - DVNO (NERO Bootleg) - White >>>>Sub Focus - X Ray - Ram 5. Brookes Brothers - F-Zero - BBK 6. Drumsound and Bassline Smith - Harder Faster - Tecnique 7. NERO - Energy VIP - White 8. Grace & Klaxons - Its Not over Yet (NERO Bootleg) - White 9. Brookes Brothers - The Lost Track - No release 10. NERO - Electronics - White 11. Culture Shock & Brookes Brothers - Rework - Ram 12. Sub Focus - Druggy - Ram 13. Common - The Light (Brookes Brothers Bootleg) - White 14. ShockOne feat Elisha King - Don't You Know - Viper 15. Chino - Insatiable - New Identity 16. Brookes Brothers & Futurebound - Dawn Treader - BBK 17. NERO - Choices - Punchy Recordings

item.title: D&BA: DJ Steppa and Tonn Piper
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Fresh off the back of his recent signing to G Dub's Propaganda Recordings, Best Breakthrough DJ at last years Drum & Bass Awards DJ Steppa knocks up a killer concoction of big beats and even bigger basslines for our brand new podcast. The Leeds-based DJ has been one of the North's leading DnB figures, from his early days working at Flex Recordings through to recent releases on the likes of Radius and Blueprint, not to mention his hectic DJing schedule and weekly Radio Frequency shows. Joined by one of Manchester's finest MC Tonn Piper on hosting duties, this fast and frenetic mix is guaranteed to get you moving. Check it!
Tracklist:
1. Heist - Ambush - Co-Lab 2. Taxman - Scan Darker - Ganja 3. Chase & Status - Hurt You - Ram 4. Original Sin - Cheater Cheater - Ganja 5. Clipz - Download (VIP) - Audio Zoo 6. Hazard & D-Minds - Mr Happy - Playaz 7. Dillinja - Make It Work - Valve 8. Clipz - Rubbish (VIP) - Audio Zoo 9. Friction - 3rd Degree Gurns - Valve 10. Original Sin - Don't Be Silly - Ganja 11. High Contrast - If We Ever - Hospital 12. Lynx - Disco Dodo - Creative Source 13. Friction & Nu-Balance - Robocop (Taxman Remix) - Playaz 14. Steppa & Kitcha - The Business - Blueprint

item.title: D&BA: Evil Quest and Juiceman
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Skimrock Project 1 label boss & producer Evil Quest is a name to watch out for this year with some killer jump up releases in the pipeline. Also working closely with Kenny Ken’s Mix N Blen’ imprint and the Digital Project the future is bright for this Midlands based producer. If you like your beats raw & your basslines dutty buckle up and sit tight for this heavyweight session.

item.title: D&BA: Subwave Studio Mix
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description: Meet Subwave, Russia's most versatile producer and dj, newest addition to the Metalheadz family. Goldie was so impressed with Subwave's music that he made him first non-UK artist to have a release on prestigious Metalheadz Platinum imprint, alongside D-Bridge, Klute, Calyx and Total Science. Subwave takes us on exclusive journey through some of the most forward thinking drum&bass to hit the shelves in 2008. You heard it here first!

item.title: D&BA: DJ Basher
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description: DJ Basher has swiftly risen through the ranks since receiving the call from Ram head honcho Andy C signing him to sister label Frequency Records. After his first release as part of the Ram fraternity, ‘Leachcraft’ he has gone on to release another big Frequency 12” ‘The Ark’ plus a 12” for Bailey’s Intasound. With his next huge Frequency release, ‘Speckled Frog / Missile’, ready to drop early next year, Basher is soon set to be the next fully fledged member of the prestigious Ram artist roster, joining the likes of Noisia, Xample, Sub Focus and Chase & Status along the way. Check this new podcast as Basher rolls out an hour of fresh beats from the likes of the Ram camp plus Hive, Spor, TC, Ed Rush & Optical, Hazard and more.

item.title: D&BA: DJ B.Traits & MC GQ
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description: B.Traits began making a name for herself in Vancouver, Canada in 2004 through her frequent dancefloor assaults on unsuspecting clubs across the Pacific Northwest. By the age of 21 she had already played alongside DnBís finest from North America and across Europe and, after teaming up with MC Kay to form Ladies Take Control (LTC), began to perform as part of DJ SSí legendary Formation crew. 2006 and 2007 saw the duo embark on Formationís World Of Drum & Bass tour and more recently B Traits has caught the eye of Shy FX and his Digital Soundboy camp, becoming the first official Digital Sound girl. Here she drops her very exclusive first Digital Soundboy mix alongside the mighty MC GQ. Packed full of fresh exclusives and unreleased dubs this mix is not to be missed. Also watch out for her first Digital Soundboy outingís in 2008.
item.itunes:subtitle: DJ B.Traits drops her very exclusive first Digital Soundboy mix alongside the mighty MC GQ.

item.title: D&BA: Hype Interview
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Early is not a word often used in the music industry, but early it had to be to catch 1Xtra's DJ of the year, Hype, before he disappeared off to Bordeaux, as he runs through the mixing and making of this chart topping, heavy weight mix album from Drum & Bass Arena.
The mix includes exclusives such as Hazard's Busted (Hype special mix), TC Ft. Jakes Raising the Roof (Hype Special mix) and unreleased material with Lynx's Disco Dodo, Dillinja's Tunnel Grinder, Friction and Nu Balance's Robocop (Taxman Remix) along with the biggest and best tunes that define a huge year for Drum & Bass.

item.title: D&BA: Silver and MC Dino

item.description:

item.title: D&BA: Aaron Jay
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description: After three and half years as a Swerve resident, Aaron Jay is about to launch a new label in the new year; ‘Influence Records’. The label will be showcasing a deeper side to the drum and bass spectrum whilst also pushing new artist from around the globe. Artists already signed to the label are studio partner Lynx (Soul:r, Creative Source), ICR from Hungary, Kjell (Creative Source) and new boy Brother. Other artists expected to grace the label are RawQ (New York), Mixmaster Doc (New York, 31 Records), Naibu (Paris, Creative Source), Soul Intent and Eveson (Creative Source, 31 Records).
item.itunes:subtitle: In this exclusive dub mix, Swerve resident Aaron Jay showcases the kind of vibes that will be on his forthcoming label 'Influence Records'.

item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Firmly at the forefront of Neurofunk's evolution, Phace is comprised of two long time friends Florian and Nicolas both twenty seven years of age, they hail from South-West Germany. Since forming in 1999, they have been dedicated, some would say addicted, to refining their unique sound.
The very definition of cutting-edge music.

item.title: D&BA: Defcom Records / Osiris Music
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Since establishing Defcom Records in 1999 Kryptic Minds & Leon Switch have been at the forefront of the deeper & darker side of Drum & Bass, renowned for their consistently high quality output and unique sounds. Now in 2007, Defcom continues its quality string of releases and recently saw the release of the duo’s critically acclaimed debut LP, ‘Lost All Faith’. This breathtaking epic had everyone from Adam F to Paradox talking and was hailed as one of Drum & Bass’s defining albums and a future classic.
Meanwhile Defcom’s fledgling sister label, Osiris, continues to go from strength to strength with new skool artists such as Sabre and Survival leading the charge.
In this exclusive Drum & bass Arena Podcast Kryptic Minds & Leon Switch guide listeners on a journey through the Defcom & Osiris sound, showcasing forthcoming cuts from the labels alongside some of ‘Lost All Faith’s’ highlights and Defcoms biggest releases.
item.itunes:subtitle: A journey through the Defcom & Osiris sound, showcasing forthcoming cuts from the labels, alongside some of ‘Lost All Faith’s’ highlights and Defcoms biggest releases.

item.title: D&BA: Bounce Records - Scheme, Roughcut and Foxy
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
"F*ck off" heralds a new era for bounce records. It's the first release since signing Roughcut exclusively to the label and serves as a warning of things to come from the camp. This Podcast showcases Bounce, its diversity, energy and Roughcuts already impressive production credits.
Bounce have plenty of new Roughcut and Foxy material lined up and with EP's due from Lomax and Roughcut along with a busy release schedule from sister labels; Jump, Deep and Bounce Digital. Expect big things from the Bounce Records crew in the future.
item.itunes:subtitle: Exclusive Bounce Records mix. Showcasing their diversity, energy and Roughcuts already impressive production credits.

item.title: D&BA: The Qemists Feat MC ID
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Brighton trio The Qemists have been described as ' A hard stick of Brighton Rock, massive Drum n Bass bangers and a glistening stream of Jazz' so be sure to expect the unexpected as they drop an exclusive mix for the latest Drum & Bass Arena Podcast.
Between the three of them, they have worked in every musical capacity available, from remixers to live sound for the likes of Coldcut, Basement Jaxx, Dreadzone, Kano, Lady Sovereign, as well as many of the biggest names in Drum n Bass.
In 2005 their debut release on Ninja Tune, a remix of Coldcut's "Everything is under control" had massive support from Radio 1's Zane Lowe, 1Xtra's Crissy Criss, Andy C and Pendulum. Always on a mission to do something different, their 3 man, 2 deck, 2 laptop DJ set was born, bursting with double drops, live remixes and the sound of technology. Check out this exclusive mix alongside Brighton's number one MC ID.
item.itunes:subtitle: Exclusive Qemists mix featuring Brighton's number one MC ID. Always on a mission to do something different, their 3 man, 2 deck, 2 laptop DJ set was born, bursting with double drops, live remixes and the sound of technology.

item.title: D&BA: Majistrate and Nicol feat MC Funsta
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description:
Hot on the heels of their Bingo 12” ‘Upside Down / Psychosis’, the deadly duo drop an exclusive upfront mix for our latest Drum & Bass Arena Podcast featuring forthcoming tracks alongside tried and tested bangers. Joined by the host with the most, MC Fun, buckle up tight and enjoy the ride as Nicol & Majistrate drop the bombs.
Currently tearing up dancefloors across the globe, 2007 has most definitely been Nicol & Majistrate’s year. Following killer releases on a host of labels including Low Down Deep, Frequency, Calypso and Frontline their collaborations as a production duo have been causing a storm. The launch of their brand new NAM Musik imprint this year saw the huge first single ‘The Countdown / Camel Toe’ smash up countless raves and receive massive DJ support.

item.title: D&BA: D.Kay
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description: David Kulenkampff is one of the most versatile beat makers in drum & bass. Equally adept at crafting big and bashy dancefloor beasts or warm and snuggly liquid funkularity, it comes as no surprise that his debut album showcases yet another string to his breakbeat bow. Coming on like a Swerve session at Ronnie Scott's, 'Individual Soul' is an amazing selection of live jazz-spliced jungle. In this exclusive podcast, D.Kay takes you through some of the many highlights. Finger clicking is essential.
item.itunes:subtitle: Coming on like a Swerve session at Ronnie Scott's, D.Kay's debut 'Individual Soul' is an amazing selection of live jazz-spliced jungle. The man himself takes you through some of the many highlights.

item.title: D&BA: DJ Andy - Emotif Recordings
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description: Sao Paulo's Anderson Cepeda is one of the most important figures in the Brazilian drum & bass scene, constantly pushing the sound to wider audiences and playing some of the biggest parties in South America. He's also not bad at putting a tune together, as releases on Phuturistic Bluez and Emotif will attest to. This exclusive podcast mix for Drum&BassArena showcases exactly why he's been an essential cog in the scene across the Atlantic for so many years, drawing on some fresh beats, and old material to construct this heavy dancefloor mixdown. Listen and understand.

item.title: D&BTV: A Gathering at Global Part 2
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description: The humor heats up with Crissy discovering academy award winner Joseph from Gloucester, Profile meets up with a Welsh Justin Timberlake whilst Sub Focus and Grooverider bring down the Accelerated tent. item.title: D&BTV: A Gathering at Global Part 1
item.itunes:author: Drum&BassArena
item.description: Crissy and Profile are back for more festival fun at Global Gathering. Nicky BM gives us the low down on his set and the up-for-it crowd. Profile goes on safari to the main stage, spots a microphone licking welshman and finds Wally. Brockie rinses out the beats with Det and Skibba on the mic and finally, after 3 takes, Profile gets his interview with him (watch out for the confused raver) and finishes off with a young one who loves D&B but didn't realize there was any at Global... bizarre!
item.itunes:subtitle: Crissy and Profile are back for more festival fun at Global Gathering.
